result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarina Marie Stone

defendant.name: Stone, Sarina Marie
defendant.address: 10892 South County Road A, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.addlTxt:
11:14 AM Defendant Sarina Marie Stone in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Sarina Marie Stone.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF506, 22CF81, and 22CF193. State notes that there is a preliminary hearing an unrelated case. Asks that this case be set for status to allow other case to catch up to work towards global resolution.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:14 AM Defendant Sarina Marie Stone in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Sarina Marie Stone.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 21CF193, Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Attorney Hoffman requests status in Oct. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

ADDRESS INFO for Sarina Marie Stone
Current: 10892 South County Road A, Solon Springs, WI 54873 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2022)
Prior: 10892 S Cty Tk A, Solon Springs, WI 54873

10:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarina Marie Stone in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Sarina Marie Stone. 
State calls Austin Lauridsen- Sworn and testifies. Officer for SPD. Relates incident. Witness identifies defendant.
Att Hoffman cross examines.
Court questions witness.
State rests
Att Hoffman- no witnesses
State- moves for bind over
Att Hoffman opposes Bind Over
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets date
Att Hoffman- requests no contact with Mr Cox be removed as bond condition
State responds, potential co-defendant, multiple incidents with the pair and possession of controlled substances.
Att Hoffman- responds
Court- Notes co-defendants can have bond condition of no contact. Not hearing enough from DA regarding bond condition. Will order no contact condition lifted No use of drugd or paraph. remains
Arraignment scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Justin Cox. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarina Marie Stone not in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Sarina Marie Stone. Attorney Reid has no information on the defendant's nonappearance. State indicates defendant was given an RTA bail slip. Asks warrant for WI and adjoining states. Attorney Reid indicates the he represent Ms. Stone and asks for an adjournment to make contact with the defendant. Court orders warrant but instructs Attorney Reid to attempt to make contact with his client.

3:47 PM Court recalls case. Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarina Marie Stone now appears in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Sarina Marie Stone. Warrant appearance set for the defendant. Court quashes warrant. Defendant's address is updated with the court. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, and requests a preliminary hearing. Attorney Reid indicates that she just mixed up the court date. Set up appearance for today after learning she missed an appearance. Has family and employment in the area. 

State asks for $5,000 cash bail. No contact with Justin Cox. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Notes that she has now 4 open felony cases in the state. Cites cash already posted in open cases and bail jumping charges. Cites defendant's prior FTAs and references missed court appearance earlier today. 

Attorney Reid asks for low cash bond or signature bond. Defendant showed up today and made herself available. Reviews contacts to the area. 

Court notes concerns over FTAs, bail jumping allegations, and other open felony cases. Court orders $5,000 cash bail. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 

Attorney Reid indicates that the defendant has $2500 on her today. State indicates that $5,000 is appropriate. 

Court changes bail amount to $2500. Conditions to remain of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State requests no contact with Justin Cox. If there is a nonappearance Court would be inclined to order upwards of $10,000 cash. Attorney Reid objects to no contact with Justin Cox, reserves argument. Court orders No contact with Justin Cox
